definitions: To spread something out, especially to display it.
To arrange something in a particular way.
To plan or design something in detail.
To spend money, especially a large amount.
To prepare a dead body for burial.
examples: She laid out all the clothes on the bed.
The architect laid out the plans for the new building.
He had to lay out a lot of money for the car repairs.
The funeral director laid out the deceased.
